result.execSummary:
The defendant James T. Mergen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
1:30 pm - 15CM43 & 15CM80 - Defendant James T. Mergen appeared in court. Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DA states agreement. DA moves to amend Ct. 1 in 15CM80 to City of Phillips Ord. 9.26(1) Disorderly Conduct. DA certifies victims rights compliance. Court orders amendment of charge. Court questions DE regarding right to attorney. DE waives right to attorney. DE pleads NO CONTEST to 15CM43 and Ct. 2 in 15CM80. Court questions DE regarding the plea.  DA explains elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC on 15CM43 and defers entry of JOC on Ct. 2 in 15CM80 for a period of 1 year. DE pleads GUILTY to Ct. 1 in 15CM80. Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders JOC. Comments by parties. Comments and ruling by Court. DA may move to amend DEJ in regards to alcohol provision. Appeal rights given. Adj. 1:44 pm. 

Court imposes:
15CM43 - $350 fine; $200 DNAAS; submit DNA sample
15CM80 (Ct. 1) - $200.50 forfeiture
15CM80 (Ct. 2) - Deferred - 1 year.  See written order. 
60 days to pay or CO.

15CM43 & 15CM80 - Defendant James T. Mergen appeared in court. Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court states 15CM43 to be rescheduled. 15CM80 -   Complaint acknowledged, reading waived.   DE waives right to attorney.  DE enters plea of NOT GUILTY to all counts.  Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled. Bond to continue.

If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release.
Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney.
1:45 pm - DA calls case and states appearances.  Defendant James T. Mergen not in court.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court orders warrant $350.00 + $25 WF.

If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release. Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney.

Defendant James T. Mergen appeared in court. Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint acknowledged, reading waived.  Court questions DE regarding right to attorney. DE waives right to attorney.   DE enters plea of GUILTY to charge. Court states penalties. DE changes plea to NOT GUILTY.   Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled.
